column4: I installed Ubuntu 10.10 on macbook pro 4,1.. i thought sound was not working becoz i coudlnt hear anything but when i connected external speakers and jacked up the volume on those to max, i could hear very faint music. .. i have all volumes to MAX in alsamixer.. what am i doing wrong?
This is only a workaround, but try installing pavucontrol and raising volume above 100%
pavucontrol is not letting me go above 100%.. also even at 100% i am getting a lot of static noise when nothing is playing
Try Xubuntu
Just get the latest Xubuntu from http://xubuntu.org
XFCE is a lot like Gnome2
You'll feel right at home with it
minixvbox, gulzar, escott ok going to format and install xubuntu.. see you shortly
XFCE is almost a Gnome2 clone. LXDE is also similar, but provides a little less widgets and such stuff, panels are not as customizable.
You need to uninstall Flash and upgrade Chrome. Chrome has flash built-in, installing another version will cause such nonsense.
how do I unstall Flash
there is a "Adobe Flash plugin" (for mozilla) .. is that the one i need to uninstall?
yeah
i uninstalled that.. and restarted chrome.. is still get the out of date flash message
I did say you need to upgrade Chrome as well.
yeah but before that i thought i'll check if Flash was uninstalled.. but it seems its still there
Eh, told you Chrome has built-in Flash which it uses.
about:plugins can tell you if you have 1 or 2 flash versions
in about:plugins  i see.. Flash - Version: 10.3 d162 Download Critical Security Update, Shockwave Flash 10.3 d162
yoohoo that did it.. thanks for your help man :)
Cool. I'm not a man though. Don't assume.
oops sorry
MonkeyDust i am surprised bcoz now you can even get pandora in your car..
